{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Second Order Fermi Acceleration\n",
    "\n",
    "The SecondOrderFermi module implements scattering with scatter centers moving in random directions. Here, we investigate the scattering process at a fixed energy. \n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import crpropa\n",
    "\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import pylab as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "beta = 0.1\n",
    "\n",
    "acceleration = crpropa.SecondOrderFermi(beta*crpropa.c_light, 10.*crpropa.parsec)\n",
    "\n",
    "N = 100000\n",
    "E0 = 1*crpropa.PeV\n",
    "angle_to_particle = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "energy_gain = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "\n",
    "scatter_velocity_x = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "scatter_velocity_y = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "scatter_velocity_z = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "\n",
    "for i in range(N):\n",
    "\n",
    "    c = crpropa.Candidate()\n",
    "    c.current.setDirection(crpropa.Vector3d(0,0,1.))\n",
    "    c.current.setEnergy(E0)\n",
    "\n",
    "    vs = acceleration.scatterCenterVelocity(c)\n",
    "    scatter_velocity_x[i] = vs.x\n",
    "    scatter_velocity_y[i] = vs.y\n",
    "    scatter_velocity_z[i] = vs.z\n",
    "    \n",
    "    alpha = vs.getAngleTo(c.current.getDirection())\n",
    "    angle_to_particle[i] = alpha\n",
    "\n",
    "    acceleration.scatter(c, vs)\n",
    "    energy_gain[i] = c.current.getEnergy() / E0"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The angle between the particles is returned in the rest frame of the candidate. As the candidate moves in the $z$ direction here, the probability to see a particle perpendicular to that direction is smaller than parallel to this direction. Head on collisions, i.e. negative $z$ here, are more likely than tail on collisions:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 42,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "Text(0.5,0,'$\\\\alpha$ [deg]')"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 42,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 864x432 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "%matplotlib inline\n",
    "fig = plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))\n",
    "fig.suptitle('In Restframe of Particle')\n",
    "splt1 = fig.add_subplot(121)\n",
    "splt1.hist(scatter_velocity_x, bins=100, label='X', histtype='step')\n",
    "splt1.hist(scatter_velocity_y, bins=100, label='Y', histtype='step')\n",
    "splt1.hist(scatter_velocity_z, bins=100, label='Z', histtype='step')\n",
    "splt1.set_xlabel('Velocity [m/s]')\n",
    "plt.legend()\n",
    "\n",
    "splt2 = fig.add_subplot(122)\n",
    "splt2.hist(angle_to_particle / crpropa.deg, bins=100)\n",
    "splt2.set_xlabel('$\\\\alpha$ [deg]')\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The resulting distribution of energy gains/losses is"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 45,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "Text(0,0.5,'Relative Energy Gain per Collision')"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 45,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 864x432 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig = plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))\n",
    "splt1 = fig.add_subplot(121)\n",
    "splt1.hist(energy_gain, bins=100)\n",
    "splt1.set_xlabel('Relative Energy Gain per Collision')\n",
    "splt1.axvline(np.mean(energy_gain), ls='--', color='k', label='Mean')\n",
    "plt.legend()\n",
    "\n",
    "splt1 = fig.add_subplot(122)\n",
    "splt1.hist2d(angle_to_particle / crpropa.deg, energy_gain, bins=100)\n",
    "splt1.set_xlabel('Angle to Scatter Center [deg]')\n",
    "splt1.set_ylabel('Relative Energy Gain per Collision')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The mean average energy gain depends, as expected, on $\\beta^2$"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 66,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "\n",
    "betas = np.array([0.01, 0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4, .5, .6, .7, .8, .9])\n",
    "mean_gains = np.zeros_like(betas)\n",
    "std_gains = np.zeros_like(betas)\n",
    "\n",
    "N = 10000\n",
    "\n",
    "\n",
    "for j, beta in enumerate(betas):\n",
    "\n",
    "    acceleration = crpropa.SecondOrderFermi(beta*crpropa.c_light, 10.*crpropa.parsec)\n",
    "\n",
    "    E0 = 1*crpropa.PeV\n",
    "    angle_to_particle = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "    energy_gain = np.zeros(N)\n",
    "\n",
    "    for i in range(N):\n",
    "\n",
    "        c = crpropa.Candidate()\n",
    "        c.current.setDirection(crpropa.Vector3d(0,0,1.))\n",
    "        c.current.setEnergy(E0)\n",
    "\n",
    "        vs = acceleration.scatterCenterVelocity(c)\n",
    "    \n",
    "        alpha = vs.getAngleTo(c.current.getDirection())\n",
    "        \n",
    "        acceleration.scatter(c, vs)\n",
    "        energy_gain[i] = c.current.getEnergy() / E0\n",
    "    \n",
    "    mean_gains[j] = np.mean(energy_gain)\n",
    "    std_gains[j] = np.std(energy_gain)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 79,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "[<matplotlib.axis.YTick at 0x7f9d96104850>,\n",
       " <matplotlib.axis.YTick at 0x7f9d961042d0>,\n",
       " <matplotlib.axis.YTick at 0x7f9d960fa650>,\n",
       " <matplotlib.axis.YTick at 0x7f9d960b4a10>,\n",
       " <matplotlib.axis.YTick at 0x7f9d960b4fd0>]"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 79,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 432x288 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "fig = plt.figure()\n",
    "splt = fig.add_subplot(111)\n",
    "b = np.linspace(0, 1.0)\n",
    "splt.plot(b, 1+1.5*b**2, c='k', ls=':', label='Expected')\n",
    "splt.errorbar(betas, mean_gains, yerr=std_gains / np.sqrt(N), ls='None', marker='s', label='Simulation')\n",
    "splt.set_xlabel('$\\\\beta$')\n",
    "splt.set_ylabel('$\\\\Delta$E / E$_0$ ')\n",
    "splt.set_yticks([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Note that for $\\beta \\gtrsim 0.5$ the simualtion deviates from the expected behavior and overestimates the energy gain. The reason is that we assume the particle to be massless and propagating with c. For fast scatter centers, this is no longer the case resulting in too high energy gains."
   ]
  }
 ],
